comments: Nicest man in the world. Extremely patient and kind. If you go to his office hours he will help you understand the topic. Great teacher overall.

Another downside is that he doesn\'t assign letter grades on the exams - making it impossible to accurately asses your performance. He will only give you ranges of where you should be; therefore, if you\'re one of those people who need an A in this class, you\'re gambling a bit since he doesn\'t tell you the curve of the exams until after the final.

For an intro to stony brook class, it is bad, since ethics doesn\'t relate to SBU, but interesting ethics class. The teacher is very knowledgeable and informative, but students intelligence falls all across the spectrum. This makes for mostly retarded ethics discussions, but once in a while, there are coherent, intelligent exchanges that take place.
